title: Curriculum overview - Morphosis
text:
The curriculum at Indian Institute of Information Technology, Nagpur (IIITN) is designed to provide a strong academic foundation while encouragingcritical thinking, innovation, and interdisciplinary learning. Through a balanced mix ofcore courses, electives, and hands-on experiences, our students gain the knowledge and skills necessary for success in their chosen fields—and beyond.
Graduates will be able to:
Extra 3 credits in OC depend on department or student choice.

title: College clubs - Morphosis
text:
DotSlash, the renowned coding club at the Indian Institute of Information Technology Nagpur (IIITN), is dedicated to students who are passionate about competitive programming and coding challenges.
The primary goal of DotSlash is to offer a platform for students to participate in coding contests, enhance their programming skills through classes, and engage in discussions about contest strategies and techniques. DotSlash plays a crucial role in empowering students with the skills and knowledge needed for success in competitive programming and beyond.
DotSlash organizes monthly coding contests, conducts post-contest discussions to clarify doubts, and hosts major events during the Tantra Fiesta such as CodeFeista, Algorithmia, and Quant Quest. The club also runs yearly programs and collaborations to guide students in competitive programming.
-  Monthly Contest on Hackerrank
-  Post Contest Discussion (PCD) after every CodeChef and monthly contest
-  Tantra Feista events: CodeFeista, Algorithmia, Quant Quest
-  Four-week Competitive Programming program in collaboration with GDG starting from Sept 21
-  Coding contests on the 10th of every month
- Winter of Code
-  February Code Challenge
Instagram: @thedotslashcommunity
Email: dotslash@iiitn.ac.in
Elevate is a peer-to-peer (P2P) skill development club dedicated to empowering students to enhance their skills and knowledge in various domains. Our goal is to foster pi(π)-shaped learning, where individuals not only gain depth in one area but also develop cross-disciplinary skills to complement their expertise. By promoting a holistic approach to learning, we encourage students to explore diverse fields, fostering both technical proficiency and creative thinking, which are essential for success in today’s dynamic world. Elevate is the platform where students learn, grow, and collaborate to shape their future.
Elevate operates through collaboration, mentorship, and hands-on activities. Members engage in interactive sessions, workshops, coding events, quizzes, and real-time problem solving. The club fosters a self-driven environment where members teach and learn from each other through structured events and informal peer learning.
Recruitment is open to all students through an application followed by a basic screening process. Enthusiasm, willingness to learn, and collaborative spirit are key selection criteria. Interviews or skill assessments may be conducted for core team roles.
- Faculty Coordinator
- President
- Vice President
- Event Heads
- Design & Content Team
- Technical & Outreach Teams
- Club Members
A high-stakes team quiz competition with a twist: every wrong answer results in half the team being randomly eliminated. The finale features a head-to-head battle for the ultimate title of Last Man Standing.
A multidisciplinary hackathon allowing use of any tech stack to solve real-world problems. The event includes multiple judging rounds to filter out the most creative, efficient, and impactful solutions.
A 24-hour code sprint where teams fix bugs in a variety of repositories, from beginner-friendly to avanced.  P  Points are earned for each bug fixed, encouraging team collaboration and de   tech dives.
A workshop series to prepare students for technical interviews with resume reviews, soft skill sessions, and    mock interviews with personalized feedback.
A 3-day tech extravaganza combining various technical challenges and activities to push creativity and problem-solving across domains.
Email: elevate@iiitn.ac.in
LinkedIn: Elevate IIITN
Instagram: @elevate_iiitn
Strokes aims to be more than just a design club; it is a creative hub dedicated to fostering a deep understanding of design principles, UI/UX, and artistic expression. Our mission is to empower students with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in design, whether they are club members or students from other disciplines. We strive to create a collaborative environment where creativity thrives, and learning is a continuous process.
Strokes is a vibrant design club at IIIT Nagpur dedicated to fostering creativity and innovation among students passionate about art, design, and technology. Our mission is to provide a collaborative space where budding designers can explore and enhance their skills in various design disciplines, including graphic design, UI/UX, 3D modeling, and digital art. Strokes offers a platform for members to engage in workshops, participate in design challenges, and collaborate on real-world projects, helping them build a strong portfolio. With a focus on learning and growth, the club also emphasizes knowledge-sharing, ensuring that students from all backgrounds can gain insights into design principles and industry-standard tools. Whether you're an aspiring designer or a seasoned artist, Strokes welcomes you to join our creative community and leave your mark.
● Design-A-Thon: UI/UX hackathon involving real-world case studies and spontaneous design challenges.
● Branding Event: Multidisciplinary competition combining design, public speaking, and media skills.
● Canvas Chronicles: Art showcase mimicking an art museum setting to display student artwork.
● UXexplorer: UI/UX design hackathon focused on usability, aesthetics, and user-centric problem solving.
● Rang: Intra-college physical design event for all students to explore tangible creativity.
● Monthly Design Workshops: Cover typography, color theory, composition, and UI principles through hands-on sessions.
● Local Design Hackathons: On-campus events promoting creativity and design problem-solving in real-world contexts.
Official Email: strokes@iiitn.ac.in
Instagram: @strokes_iiitn_
LinkedIn: strokes-the-iiitn-design
Discord: strokes | the iiitn design club
IoTics, the IoT and Robotics wing of Indian Institute of Information Technology, Nagpur, is dedicated to fostering innovation and awareness in the field of IoT and Roborics. Founded in 2021, the club has since grown to become a vital part of the college community.
IoTics is driven by a passionate community of students and faculty advisors who share a common vision of harnessing technology to address real-world challenges. The club operates on a fundamental principle of experiential learning, empowering its members to gain practical insights into the fields of IoT and Robotics, and then share their knowledge with thire fellow members. The club believes in the power of peer education, where members teach and learn from one another, fostering a collaborative and supportive environment for growth and exploration.
The club conducts a variety of initiatives, including workshops, seminars, and hands-on projects, which not only provide a platform for theoretical knowledge but also serve as a testing ground for innovative ideas to materialize. IoTics thrives on the shared spirit of exploration and discovery that each member brings to the table.
The club is led by its Head, who oversees operations. In the Head’s absence, decision-making authority is entrusted to the Co-Lead. Additionally, there is a dedicated team responsible for initiating and coordinating technical projects within the club.
At TantraFiesta, we host several exciting events:
Teams navigate RC cars through an obstacle course designed to test performance under challenging conditions.
Teams build projects that combine IoT and AI, with creativity and application being the key judging factors.
Teams develop bots to follow a line track quickly and accurately through loops, curves, and intersections.
We aim to foster a culture of IoTics within the college by conducting a series of workshops for junior students. These workshops will provide hands-on experience and valuable insights into IoT and robotics. At year-end, we plan to host an exhibition for participants to showcase their projects and innovations. Furthermore, we will collaborate with various college clubs for a hybrid event, enriching the experience for all participants. Ongoing projects within the club will continue to inspire and motivate members, strengthening the IoT and robotics ecosystem in the college.
Email: iotics@iiitn.ac.in
Instagram: @iotics_iiitn
LinkedIn: IoTics club IIITN
The Dimensions Club was created out of a strong commitment to guide students through the ever-evolving worlds of AR, VR, XR, MR, game development, VFX, and virtual production. Recognizing the increasing significance of these technologies, the club equips IIIT Nagpur students with the tools, knowledge, and support to thrive in these cutting-edge fields.
At its core, Dimensions fosters innovation, creativity, and hands-on exploration. The club serves as a platform where education intersects with imagination—offering students opportunities to explore human-computer interaction and game technologies through collaborative projects and real-world applications.
Dimensions functions through a combination of:
- Long-term projects (primarily focused on game development and immersive tech)
- Workshops and expert seminars on AR/VR, VFX, and gaming
- Game jams and hackathons
- Project showcases at college-level fests like TantraFiesta
- Integration with academic curriculum (especially HCI-GT)
Students get to work on real games and immersive experiences, sharpening both technical and creative skills.
Open to all students with a passion for game development, XR, and immersive technologies. Selection may involve a basic screening or submission of design/development work. Enthusiasm and dedication are key.
Faculty Coordinator
Club Head
Co-Lead
Technical Team
Creative & Media Team
Project Leads
Club Members
Multiple ongoing video game projects with planned demos by the end of 2024.
Showcasing prototypes and early builds of game projects at the annual tech fest.
Short, high-paced development events to spark creativity and hands-on learning.
Hands-on sessions and expert talks focused on AR/VR, game engines, virtual production, and more.
Projects aligned with the HCI-GT curriculum for 1st and 2nd year students.
Expand the game development culture across the college.
- Aim to release at least one full video game on platforms like Steam.
- Conduct AR/VR-based workshops and seminars.
- Strengthen club integration with HCI-GT courses.
- Promote cross-branch collaboration and a hands-on learning environment.
Email: dimensions@iiitn.ac.in
Instagram: @dimensions.iiitn
LinkedIn: Dimensions Club IIITN

At Udyam, formerly known as ACE, the focus is on igniting the spirit of entrepreneurship and innovation. Their mission is to empower aspiring entrepreneurs, startups, and small businesses by providing them with the knowledge, resources, and support necessary to turn their innovative ideas into successful ventures. Udyam believes in the transformative power of innovation to drive economic growth, create employment opportunities, and shape a brighter future. Acting as a catalyst, Udyam fosters a dynamic entrepreneurial ecosystem where creativity and determination converge. Through mentorship, expert guidance, and a strong network of like-minded individuals, Udyam strives not only to fuel business growth but also to inspire and nurture the spirit of innovation in every endeavor.
Udyam functions as an entrepreneurial hub where students collaborate to cultivate business ideas, explore real-world challenges, and implement creative solutions. Through events, mentorship, and community-building, the club offers a structured approach to transforming concepts into viable ventures.
● Group Discussion
● Startup Weekend
● Orientation
● Pitch Perfect
● Open House
● Workshop on Sales Fundamentals
● E-Summit
● Entrepreneurship in Action Forum
● Regional E-cell Conference
● Podcast Session
● Collaboration with IIM and other colleges
● Collaboration with MNLU
Email: udyam@iiitn.ac.in
Instagram: ecell_iiitn
LinkedIn: UDYAM IIITN

CRISPR or Central Research Initiative and Student Public Relations Club of IIIT Nagpur had set out a mission to positively change their college's cultural, technical, and interpersonal DNA by creating an innovative and collaborative community. CRISPR is derived from a gene editing tool that can edit DNA on the atomic scale. Just like the scientific CRISPR machine, the CRISPR initiative is here to edit and shape the cultural DNA of the college positively.
One of the main objectives of CRISPR is to fill the void that exists in many clubs and organisations, which often did not take the initiative to do something new and innovative. One of the biggest initiatives taken by CRISPR were the development and deployment of college’s own FTP network for seamless resource sharing over the intranet, one of its major flagship projects is its fortnightly newsletter which focuses on hyperlocal issues of the campus community, CRISPR also built the reddit community of the college, deployed project Revamp, which focused on drastically improving the college’s online presence over various internet platforms, CRISPR has worked on organising various internal/external hackathons and events most importantly EnigmaXplore- Central India’s First CTF!, GPT-3.5 hackathon, Marketwise Data Science hackathon in E-summit and much more.
CRISPR is a place where everyone is welcome to participate, share their ideas, and collectively collaborate on new and innovative projects. The goal is to inspire creativity, and provide a space where all students can realise their potential and make a positive impact on the college and beyond.
-     FTP Server - Locally hosted ftp server aimed to provide the students access to plethora of knowledge and content ranging from courses, PYQs to movies and games.
-     Reddit Community - The 5th largest subreddit amongst all government funded colleges in India
-     Morphosis - IIIT Nagpur’s wiki engine. Morphosis aims to become a go-to source for a vast array of information, knowledge, and resources.
-     AuthBahn - A Chrome extension that automates secure logins for FortiGate firewall, enhancing efficiency and security
-     Campus Pulse - Newsletter Published Biweekly
-    EnigmaXplore - Being first of its kind in central India, CRISPR organised Capture the Flag(CTF) event in TantraFiesta’23, gathering overwhelming participation across India it became an appreciable effort showing.
-    GPT 3.5 Solve-A-Thon - The GPT 3.5 Solve-A-Thon at TantraFiesta’23 featured online quizzes, offline coding challenges, and a 12-hour hackathon, showcasing innovative AI-driven solutions to real-world problems.
-    Market Wise - Marketwise at E-Summit'24 was a data science and machine learning competition that included a workshop, two competitive rounds, and a 36-hour hackathon finale. Teams                        addressed real-world challenges and demonstrated their expertise.
-     TF’24: Conducting second editions of both GPT 4.0 Solve-a-Thon and Analytica datathon with further innovations.
-    Demo Days: Initiating demo days, this recurring event, aims to ignite the spirit of creativity among students by providing a platform where they can present and demonstrate their groundbreaking projects and transformative ideas.
-      How to Ace 3.0: CRISPR’s own alumni connection program is set to go on air very soon, much like How to Ace 2.0 it will be broadcasted online as a series of multiple interview episodes.
-      Campus Pulse 2.0: As the legacy of Campus Pulse carries on by the fresher batch the new edition of the CRISPR’s newsletter for our campus will be taken up by the 2028 batch.
-     ESummit’25: CRISPR is undergoing talks with Udyam-Ecell in order to reorganise Marketwise 2.0 in Esummit’25.
-     Collaboration with IotiCs: CRISPR will be collaborating with Iotics club in organising a workshop regarding IOT-Security tentatively scheduled in the first half of 2025.
-     Server workshops, Badal deployment, Server UI revamp, Smart Entry/exit, and many more projects are underway.
Email: crispr@iiitn.ac.in
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/crispr_iiitn
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/crispr-iiit-nagpur/

Crescendo, the vibrant music club of the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Nagpur, was established in 2020 by a visionary group of senior students passionate about creating a harmonious community. True to its name, Crescendo symbolizes the continuous rise of musical energy, weaving melodies into the fabric of IIIT Nagpur. The club's mission is not only to elevate musical expression but to inspire creativity and camaraderie within the institute.
At the heart of Crescendo is a thriving community of musicians, performers, and technical wizards, each contributing their unique talents. From soulful vocalists and dynamic guitarists to skilled drummers, flautists, and versatile instrumentalists, Crescendo embraces all forms of musical expression. The club doesn't stop at just performance; it's a holistic space where technical experts manage sound consoles, lighting, and event logistics, while creative teams handle social media, corporate collaborations, content creation, and event management.
Crescendo stands as a cornerstone of the cultural scene at IIIT Nagpur. Its influence spans from headlining performances at the annual cultural fest, Abhivyakti, to hosting jam sessions and open mic nights. The club isn't just about musical performers but also provides a place for people to vanquish their stage fright. The club hosts workshops on sound engineering and console management. It continuously raises the bar for cultural excellence at IIIT Nagpur, leaving a lasting impact on both its members and the institute.
At Abhivyakti, we host several exciting events:
• Solo Singing: A person entertains the crowd by their singing skills, captivating the audience with their voice, emotional expression, and musical talent, creating a memorable experience.
• Band Battle: In a thrilling competition, bands face off, showcasing their unique sound and energy. Each group has a set time to perform, impressing judges and audience alike.
• Instrumental: Instrumental performances highlight musicians' skills without vocals. The focus is on melody, harmony, and rhythm, creating powerful emotions and stories through pure, unspoken music.
Other events of Crescendo are:
• Musica Noxx: A three day cultural event organized by first years where they showcase their music performances and learn basic concepts of event management.
• Road to recruit: New students audition by showcasing their musical talents on stage. This event is their chance to impress, demonstrate their skills, and join the music club.
We are dedicated to fostering a vibrant music culture within our college by organising frequent jamming sessions and technical workshops. These will offer valuable hands-on experience and deeper musical insights. Throughout the year, we'll host a variety of smaller events to keep enthusiasm high and creativity flowing. At TantraFiesta, our annual tech fest, we plan to feature a unique and innovative event that highlights the diverse talents of our members. Our ongoing activities will inspire and energise the musical spirit within our college community.
Email: crescendo@iiitn.ac.in
Instagram: crescendo_iiitn
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/crescendo-iiitn/

At D-TARAXIA, we believe that dance is more than just movement, it’s a vibrant expression of creativity, culture and community. Whether you are a seasoned dancer or someone looking to explore a new passion, our club offers a welcoming space for everyone to share in the joy of dance.
• Ganesh Chaturthi & Navaratri Garba
Introductory sessions:
A workshop will be held to prepare participants for the Ganesh Chaturthi event & Navaratri Event, focusing on traditional dance forms like: Garaba, Lavni, Gondhal, and classical performances, ensuring everyone is well-prepared to contribute to the celebration
• Tantrafiesta
The opening ceremony of TantraFesta will commence with a Classical Vandana, a revered and time-honored tradition in Indian performing arts. The Vandana can be dedicated to deities like Saraswati, the Goddess of Knowledge, Shiva, the Lord of Dance (Nataraja) or Ganesha, the remover of obstacles and the god of beginnings. Each deity's Vandana has its unique significance and traditional compositions that bring spiritual energy to the performance.
• Abhivyakti
To prepare and train students across various dance categories such as solo, duet and group ensuring they are ready to showcase their best performances at the Abhivyakti. Our goal is to develop their skills, boost their confidence, and help them deliver impactful performances that highlight their creativity and technical abilities.
• Workshops
Periodic workshops with instructors specializing in diffetext dance forms to enhance versatility and introduce new techniques. A workshop will be organized to train first-year students for      Naatyaaksh, focusing on integrating dance and drama under the mentorship of senior club members, ensuring they are equipped with the necessary skills for the event.
• Naatyaaksh
It's a collaboration between D-Taraxia and Estoria. The objective of Naatyaaksh is to empower first-year students by giving them the opportunity to organize and lead a major event. Under the mentorship of experienced club leads and co-leads, they will learn the intricacies of event management, choreography, and performance, while showcasing their talents to the wider community.
Inter-college Dance events:
By organizing these inter-college events, our dance club will not only gain recognition but also create memorable experiences that resonate with participants and spectators alike.
-  Benefits of these events:
-  Recognition
-  Networking
-  Skill Enhancement
-  Cultural Exchange
Email: dtaraxia@iiitn.ac.in
Instagram: d.taraxia_iiitn

title: Fresher's Party - Morphosis
text:
Perfect, thanks for the clarification! Here's an updated version that accurately reflects the student-led and self-organized nature of the Freshers’ Party at IIIT Nagpur:
At IIIT Nagpur, theFreshers' Partyis a unique, unofficial student-organized event that celebrates the beginning of college life for the first-year batch. Unlike traditional setups in many institutions, the freshers at IIIT Nagpur take complete charge of organizing their own welcome party—right from planning to execution.
The event is entirely planned and hosted by first-year students themselves. A dedicated team is formed within the batch—often from theOC (Organizing Committee)—to handle everything from budgeting, collecting entry fees, selecting a venue, managing logistics, and curating the event experience.
Although unofficial and independent of the institute’s formal calendar, the Freshers’ Party plays a key role in fostering early friendships, creating unforgettable memories, and promoting team spirit and event management experience among first-year students.

title: Sports facilities - Morphosis
text:
Indian Institute of Information Technology, Nagpur (IIIT Nagpur) emphasizes the importance of sports and physical fitness as an integral part of student life. The institute provides various indoor and outdoor sports facilities to encourage participation and promote a healthy lifestyle.
The campus has designated grounds and courts for outdoor games, including:
The campus includes a full-sized football ground that serves as a venue for practice sessions, friendly matches, and institute-level tournaments
Surrounding the football ground is a dedicated running track that supports athletic activities and regular fitness routines.
Outdoor badminton courts are accessible to students for casual games and sports events throughout the day.
An open-air gym with basic fitness equipment allows students to engage in strength training and cardio workouts in a natural environment.
The institute provides table tennis tables in a dedicated TT room on the 8th floor of the hostel
Chess boards and carrom boards are available in the common room on the 6th floor of the hostel
A well-equipped indoor gym is situated on the 5th floor of the hostel with workout machines and free weights for strength and cardio training.
Kshitij is the annual sports fest of IIIT Nagpur, serving as a platform for students to showcase their athletic talent and team spirit. The fest features a wide array of events across multiple sports, including cricket, football, basketball, sprinting, table tennis, chess, carrom, badminton, powerlifting, kabaddi, kho-kho, discus throw, and volleyball.
IIIT Nagpur participates in Inter-IIIT tournaments held across the country. Students compete in various sports including swimming, table tennis, lawn tennis, carrom, chess, powerlifting, badminton, cricket, volleyball and football.

title: Internship details
text:
Gain educational and professional research experience at IIIT Nagpur.
This program is designed to provide educational and professional research experience to budding engineers.
The program offers an opportunity for B.Tech / B.E. / MSc. (Computer Science, Electronics & Communication, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics) / MCA students from institutions and universities across the nation to gain exposure to the research environment at IIIT Nagpur.
In this program, the students need to be physically present in the institute premises and have to undergo the given assignment and the project under the supervision of the expert. Required Training and Guidance on the selected project will be provided. Also, access to the needed computational & Library resources will be provided
In this program, the students need not be physically present in the institute premises and have to undergo the given assignment and the project under the supervision of the expert through online mode. Required Training and Guidance on the selected project will be provided.
Students should directly apply to the faculty member only on their email id by sending a latest Resume or CV (indicating the Grades and Technical skills) mentioning the subject in the mail "Request for Six/Two months internship at IIIT Nagpur".
After getting the consent from the faculty, students are required to forward the internship joining application form along with the registration form (in the prescribed format) and the details of the fee payment to the Internship Cell and admin office at email ids:oaaccounts@iiitn.ac.inandinternships@iiitn.ac.in.
The registration fee should be deposited only after the selection confirmation from the supervisor.
Any student who is pursuing B. Tech / B. E. / M. Tech / M.Sc. in the following fields:
For Undergraduate students: He/she must have cleared the first 2 semesters of B.E. / B. Tech.
The duration of the internship will be either 2 months or 6 months.
If required, the duration of the 2-month internship can be extended to 6 months with the recommendation of the supervisor and the approval of the competent authority. In that case, the student needs to pay the difference amount for further extension.
The internship can be conducted in the following modes:
Fees need to be paid byNEFT/RTGS/IMPSin the following bank account:
Note:Please ensure to upload the payment receipt when submitting your application.

title: Hostel fees details
text:
ANNEXURE – 1
DETAILS OF HOSTEL FEES
DETAILS OF HOSTEL FEES
Fees as per Room occupancy (in RS.)
2nd Year & 3rd Year 4th Year *
Sr. No Particulars
Double Four Double Four
Seater Seater Seater Seater
1 Room Rent 30000 15000 15000 7500
2 Advance Electricity
Charges (Adjustable 15000 15000 7500 7500
as per Actuals)
3 Advance Water
Charges (Adjustable 2000 2000 2000 2000
as per Actuals)
4 Recreation 2000 2000 2000 2000
5 Allied Services 20000 20000 10000 10000
6 Mess Charges (
Adjustable as per 40000 40000 20000 20000
Actuals)
7 Mess Deposite (one
0 0 0 0
time)
8 Caution Money (
2000 2000 2000 2000
Refundable)
9 Depreciation Fund
0 0 0 0
(One Time)
10 Welfare Fee (One
0 0 0 0
Time)
Grand Total Hostel Charges = 111000 96000
Odd Semester Fees= 76000 68500 58500 51000
Even Semester Fees= 35000 27500
Note:-
Allotment of the Rooms in the Hostel shall be done on “ First Come First” Basis
Students have to deposited the Odd Semester Fees as indicated above to facilitate
Hostel Allotment
The room Allotment shall be done by the Institute and no change shall be permitted
without prior approval of the Competent Authority.
*in case of the 4th year (Final Year), the students opting for 6 Months outside campus
internship &not staying in the Hostel shall have to pay reduced fees depending on
occupancy type. The fees shall be payable at the start of the On campus Semester.
The students residing for the full year I Hostel have to pay full fees as applicable for
2nd/3rd year for 4th year also.
